intro: Struthanthus yavitensis, commonly known as the Yavit's struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
